Validation: Assuring Data Integrity

Why it matters

"Data validation rules are the core of a Holochain app."

Holochain DNAs can specify validation rules for DHT operations. This empowers agents to check the integrity of the data they see.

Validation: the beating heart of Holochain

Unlike blockchain systems where validation is performed by a special class of nodes (miners or validators), in Holochain every participant validates the data they encounter.

This distributed validation approach ensures data integrity without requiring consensus mechanisms or proof-of-work.

How validation rules are defined

A validation rule is simply a callback function in an integrity zome that takes an operation, analyzes it, and returns a validation result.

You define these rules using the HDK (Holochain Development Kit) functions like validate_create_entry, validate_update_entry, etc.
